commit_message:
Remove erroneous octavia code related to sync_db

The octavia api manifest includes a conditional that appears to be
related to database synchronization that can be removed as the this is
handled by passing the value of sync_db to the octavia puppet module.

Change-Id: I1426b9066c7af76492c4ab75e421c4db9f8cc65f

commit_message:
Do not rely on openstack-puppet-modules

We are removing openstack-puppet-modules package since we now have
individual packages for each Puppet module.
We can still rely on puppet-tripleo module to deploy all dependencies.

Change-Id: Iad2c08a83210958193d844b9ad15b882b8b6d7a5
Related-Bug: #1676998

Don't drop batch on one bad metric

Change-Id: I313cfc26fa6ab6abf0415a4e43889c2a7a2b7cfe

added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2017 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP import unittest import os import monasca_agent.common.config as configuration import monasca_agent.common.metrics as metrics_pkg from monasca_agent.collector.checks import AgentCheck base_config = configuration.Config(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), 'test-agent.yaml')) class TestAgentCheck(unittest.TestCase): def testBadMetricKeepBatch(self): agent_config = base_config.get_config(sections='Main') check = AgentCheck("foo", {}, agent_config) dimensions = {'A': 'B', 'B': 'C', 'D': 'E'} value_meta = {"This is a test": "test, test, test"} check.submit_metric("Foo", 5, metrics_pkg.Gauge, dimensions=dimensions, delegated_tenant=None, hostname=None, device_name=None, value_meta=value_meta) self.assertEqual(len(check.aggregator.metrics), 1) dimensions = {'A': '()', 'B': 'C', 'D': 'E'} value_meta = {"This is a test": "test, test, test"} check.submit_metric("Bar", 5, metrics_pkg.Gauge, dimensions=dimensions, delegated_tenant=None, hostname=None, device_name=None, value_meta=value_meta) self.assertEqual(len(check.aggregator.metrics), 1) dimensions = {'A': 'B', 'B': 'C', 'D': 'E'} value_meta = {"This is a test": "test, test, test"} check.submit_metric("Baz", 5, metrics_pkg.Gauge, dimensions=dimensions, delegated_tenant=None, hostname=None, device_name=None, value_meta=value_meta) self.assertEqual(len(check.aggregator.metrics), 2)

commit_message:
Adds Rally support for Barbican scenarios

Added code to get a python-barbican client object,
Barbican-secret test cases. Added clean up functions.
Added unit tests for all new scenarios.

Change-Id: I33d90afeaee273662e7bb6b7637736c8b94ac9e9
Closes-bug: #1549141

added_lines: def _get_barbican_session(self, auth=None, endpoint=None): from keystoneclient.auth import identity from keystoneclient import session as ks_session kc = self.keystone() auth = identity.v2.Password(auth_url=kc.auth_url, username=kc.username, password=kc.password, tenant_name=kc.tenant_name) return ks_session.Session(auth=auth, verify=False) @configure("barbican", default_version="1", default_service_type="key-manager") class Barbican(OSClient): def create_client(self, version=None, service_type=None): """Return barbican client.""" from barbicanclient import client as barbican version = self.choose_version(version) api_url = self._get_endpoint(service_type) api_url += "/v%s" % version session = self._get_barbican_session(endpoint=api_url) return barbican.Client(session=session)

commit_message:
Restrict Service Catalog in Auth Response

Currently when authenticating the default response is to return the full
service catalog. In many cases, clients only care about the endpoints for a
single service and a single region, so we could save time and compute power by
only retrieving/returning the information the client cares about. Accordingly
the proposal is to add optional arguments to indicate the service-type and/or
region of interest, and these would be used to limit the catalog returned in
the response.

bp auth-response-restrict-catalog

Change-Id: If9a930dd6aaf40a4d53819592779a571de39c707
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/45/505345/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Restrict Service Catalog in Auth Response ========================================== `bp auth-response-restrict-catalog <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/auth-response-restrict-catalog>`_ Currently when authenticating the default response is to return the full service catalog. In many cases, clients only care about the endpoints for a single service and a single region, so we could save time and compute power by only retrieving/returning the information the client cares about. Accordingly the proposal is to add optional arguments to indicate the service-type and/or region of interest, and these would be used to limit the catalog returned in the response. Problem Description =================== Currently when authenticating, the default response will return the complete service catalog. In a common usage scenario it's likely that the client only actually cares about one service-type and one region, and it is a waste of time and compute power to fetch all the endpoints, build them into a response, send the response, and have the client search the response for the information they actually care about. This will be most visible when there are a large number of regions. Proposed Change =============== Add two new optional string-type parameters ``service-type`` and ``region`` to the various calls that return a service catalog, in order to limit which endpoints will be queried from the DB and returned in the ``catalog`` field of the response. If ``nocatalog`` is specified (where applicable) then these optional parameters are ignored as irrelevent. Any values specified for ``service-type`` and ``region`` will be matched exactly (in a case-sensitive way) against the endpoints, and only the matching endpoints will be returned in the service catalog. Modified API Calls ================== **Request:** ``POST /v3/auth/tokens`` **New Optional Parameters** * ``region`` - The service catalog will be limited to this region. * ``service-type`` - The service catalog will be limited to this service type. **Request:** ``GET /v3/auth/tokens`` **New Optional Parameters** * ``region`` - The service catalog will be limited to this region. * ``service-type`` - The service catalog will be limited to this service type. **Request:** ``GET /v3/auth/catalog`` **New Optional Parameters** * ``region`` - The service catalog will be limited to this region. * ``service-type`` - The service catalog will be limited to this service type. Alternatives ------------ We could potentially use project-scoped tokens and have different projects in each region, but that would be gross. Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ If the feature is implemented optimally it should reduce the amount of data returned from the DB which should result in less work to format and send the service catalog. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: cfriesen Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- 1. Implement the API changes 2. Add relevent tests 3. Update all appropriate documentation/api-ref 4. Update keystone-client/openstack-cli Dependencies ============ None Documentation Impact ==================== Update ``api-ref`` documents to show the usage of the API's. References ==========

commit_message:
Open VBMC ports for access from br-ctlplane

This is needed to test ironic in the overcloud using the same virtual nodes
as for the overcloud.

This patches adds a helper for robustly starting/stopping virtual BMCs,
which gets installed into /usr/loca/bin/quickstart-vbmc-helper.

Change-Id: Icd78eb3136ab3f4f28170700f118446e9e633ae0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/24/511824/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh if [ $(id -u) != 0 ]; then echo "Has to be run as root" exit 1 fi action=$1 if [ "$action" != 'start' ] && [ "$action" != 'stop' ]; then echo "Unknown action: $action" exit 1 fi for bmc in $(ls /root/.vbmc); do port=$(vbmc show $bmc | awk '/port/ { print $4; }') status=$(vbmc show $bmc | awk '/status/ { print $4; }') if [ -z $port ]; then echo "WARNING: failed to determine port for VBMC $bmc" fi if [ $action == start ]; then if [ "$status" == running ]; then echo "BMC $bmc is already running" else if [ -n $port ] && ! $(iptables -C INPUT -i br-ctlplane -p udp --dport $port -j ACCEPT 2> /dev/null); then iptables -I INPUT -i br-ctlplane -p udp --dport $port -j ACCEPT fi vbmc start $bmc || echo "WARNING: failed to start VBMC $bmc" echo "Started VBMC $bmc" fi else if [ -n $port ]; then iptables -D INPUT -i br-ctlplane -p udp --dport $port -j ACCEPT fi if [ "$status" != running ]; then echo "BMC $bmc is already stopped" else vbmc stop $bmc || echo "WARNING: failed to stop VBMC $bmc" echo "Stopped VBMC $bmc" fi fi done

commit_message:
WIP - Prometheus Monitoring Stack

Introduces Prometheus monitoring stack for OSH-addons. This
includes: prometheus, alertmanager, kube-state-metrics, node
exporter, a ceph exporter, cadvisor, rabbitmq exporter, and
a mysqld exporter

Change-Id: I8f7a8492326597fa33bad407654a84ea1eb951d3
Implements: blueprint osh-monitoring

commit_message:
Clean ES indices with curator cron job

Creates cronjob to clean up old elasticsearch indices. Provides
ability to configure actions and schedule interval via the values
file.

Change-Id: Iaa3a421015057fb0756192a8455808398ab50ded

commit_message:
Ceph monitoring plugin: allow using sudo

Ceph commands the Ceph check runs to query cluster status need to access
/etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring. To that end one can either add
monasca-agent to the ceph group or run monasca-agent as root. This
commit adds the use_sudo configuration option that runs ceph commands
using sudo. This is useful if your agent has sudo rights anyway due to
other plugins that require it (e.g. postfix).

Change-Id: I24075359f7090f02577cd22a1b3badcbe7041302

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-19 19:41:54.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_config.py', 'releasenotes/notes/default-cloud-7ee0bcb9e5dd24b9.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config/commit/45fd7b4a949e6cd8482b3025b96251c5832ddf23', 'message': 'Treat clouds.yaml with one cloud like envvars

If there is only one cloud and that cloud is envvars, things work as

Change-Id: Ia49d0fb2cc7dca36476d0e5ae3fe2b2aa1209e59

commit_message:
Treat clouds.yaml with one cloud like envvars

If there is only one cloud and that cloud is envvars, things work as
expected. If there is only one cloud in clouds.yaml and no envvars
cloud, we throw an error, even though it should be obvious which cloud
was intended.

Change-Id: Ia49d0fb2cc7dca36476d0e5ae3fe2b2aa1209e59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/88/505388/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- issues: - If there was only one cloud defined in clouds.yaml os-client-config was requiring the cloud parameter be passed. This is inconsistent with how the envvars cloud works which WILL work without setting the cloud parameter if it's the only cloud.

commit_message:
Clarify keepalived overrides

Keepalived overrides in OSA are now standard overrides, and
the documentation should follow the code, mentioning the
standard override mechanisms instead of the file which was
used before.

Change-Id: Ic0d17aac6aa5887ba6672557abd150cb50b1115f
Closes-Bug: #1722273
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/07/512307/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The HAProxy nodes have group vars applied that define the configuration of keepalived. This configuration is stored in ``group_vars/haproxy_all/keepalived.yml``. It contains the variables needed for the keepalived role (master and backup nodes).You can adapt keepalived to your environment by either using our override mechanisms (per host with userspace ``host_vars``, per group with userspace``group_vars``, or globally using the userspace ``user_variables.yml`` file)
deleted_lines: The HAProxy playbook reads the ``vars/configs/keepalived_haproxy.yml`` variable file and provides content to the keepalived role for keepalived master and backup nodes.You can define additional variables to adapt keepalived to your deployment. Refer to the ``user_variables.yml`` file for more information. Optionally, you can use your own variable file. For example: .. code-block:: yaml haproxy_keepalived_vars_file: /path/to/myvariablefile.yml

commit_message:
Fix Octavia jobs to be voting again

The following jobs because non-voting after zuulv3:
legacy-neutron-lbaasv2-dsvm-py3x-api
legacy-octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario
legacy-octavia-v1-dsvm-py3x-scenario

This patch returns these to be voting jobs.

Change-Id: I1d26951c80aaf9a944d76813ed2f03cb5023c82c

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-k8s-cookiecutter

This is the cookiecutter template for the ansible-role-k8s-* repos that
aim to collect ansible roles to deploy openstack services on kubernetes.
These repos, as discussed in this thread[0], will be part of the TripleO
team for now.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123295.html

Needed-by: Ie3d6d2a108af7e796133a5158678773b34a12ad2
Change-Id: Ie47461c5dab7062ea65a93a49b5c0d651f19a607
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/23/512323/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

'tempest.common.utils.services()' in version 'Pike'.
This commit update tests accordingly.

commit_message:
placement: set/check if inventory change in tree

We add a has_inventory_changed() and an update_inventory() method to
the nova.compute.provider_tree.ProviderTree object. These methods will
be used by both the resource tracker and the virt driver when they need
to set inventory information for a particular resource provider.

Change-Id: Ieea566e273fd26c8321e1183ffd0e55aa6b00c55
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/75/470575/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_has_inventory_changed_no_existing_rp(self): cns = self.compute_nodes pt = provider_tree.ProviderTree(cns) self.assertRaises( ValueError, pt.has_inventory_changed, uuids.non_existing_rp, {} ) def test_update_inventory_no_existing_rp(self): cns = self.compute_nodes pt = provider_tree.ProviderTree(cns) self.assertRaises( ValueError, pt.update_inventory, uuids.non_existing_rp, {}, 1, ) def test_has_inventory_changed(self): cn = self.compute_node1 cns = self.compute_nodes pt = provider_tree.ProviderTree(cns) rp_gen = 1 cn_inv = { 'VCPU': { 'total': 8, 'reserved': 0, 'min_unit': 1, 'max_unit': 8, 'step_size': 1, 'allocation_ratio': 16.0, }, 'MEMORY_MB': { 'total': 1024, 'reserved': 512, 'min_unit': 64, 'max_unit': 1024, 'step_size': 64, 'allocation_ratio': 1.5, }, 'DISK_GB': { 'total': 1000, 'reserved': 100, 'min_unit': 10, 'max_unit': 1000, 'step_size': 10, 'allocation_ratio': 1.0, }, } self.assertTrue(pt.has_inventory_changed(cn.uuid, cn_inv)) self.assertTrue(pt.update_inventory(cn.uuid, cn_inv, rp_gen)) # Updating with the same inventory info should return False self.assertFalse(pt.has_inventory_changed(cn.uuid, cn_inv)) self.assertFalse(pt.update_inventory(cn.uuid, cn_inv, rp_gen)) cn_inv['VCPU']['total'] = 6 self.assertTrue(pt.has_inventory_changed(cn.uuid, cn_inv)) self.assertTrue(pt.update_inventory(cn.uuid, cn_inv, rp_gen)) self.assertFalse(pt.has_inventory_changed(cn.uuid, cn_inv)) self.assertFalse(pt.update_inventory(cn.uuid, cn_inv, rp_gen)) # Deleting a key in the new record should NOT result in changes being # recorded... del cn_inv['VCPU']['allocation_ratio'] self.assertFalse(pt.has_inventory_changed(cn.uuid, cn_inv)) self.assertFalse(pt.update_inventory(cn.uuid, cn_inv, rp_gen)) del cn_inv['MEMORY_MB'] self.assertTrue(pt.has_inventory_changed(cn.uuid, cn_inv)) self.assertTrue(pt.update_inventory(cn.uuid, cn_inv, rp_gen))

commit_message:
Protect against p_opt not having prompt attribute

In ansible/ansible#28746 it was reported that there are times
when a p_opt is getting here that does not have a prompt
attribute. Protecting against that is fairly easy to do.

Change-Id: Ia02528f4a107893e480135bc214aa156b8684507
Closes-Bug: #1717906

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-18 16:30:59.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/7b157d35cebb52ce29a1974e3b4e0f5633df5ef7', 'message': "Remove py35 based template from nodepool

This template causes tox-py35 to be run on every branch of nodepool.
There is no way to disable it in-repo because this adds a variant that
matches every branch, so it will always run. We haven't been running
py35 unit tests on nodepool master branch, so this is causing us to
not be able to merge to master. A subsequent change to nodepool will
add a job variant that will cause tox-py35 to run on the feature/zuulv3
branch.

Change-Id: I59f44c55225dd0587f4b80ed388199284c93febe
"}]
commit_message:
Remove py35 based template from nodepool

This template causes tox-py35 to be run on every branch of nodepool.
There is no way to disable it in-repo because this adds a variant that
matches every branch, so it will always run. We haven't been running
py35 unit tests on nodepool master branch, so this is causing us to
not be able to merge to master. A subsequent change to nodepool will
add a job variant that will cause tox-py35 to run on the feature/zuulv3
branch.

Change-Id: I59f44c55225dd0587f4b80ed388199284c93febe

commit_message:
Use generic $USER variable for functional tests

Zuulv3 uses "zuul" user instead of "jenkins", $USER should be set to the
correct value in all cases

Change-Id: Iae78d694a97978144de542608212c77dfe69a390

commit_message:
Fix puppet-agent install

The previous declaration where we installed the puppet-agent was after
we revoked sudo access. We need this to be part of the node setup so we
need to move it out of the build run and to the node setup playbooks.

Depends-On: I2fb0301631eb69bd1e37467229bcf3dc4ab532bb
Change-Id: Id68ee1b443a4172d0c1d6d58a04908c52a566623
(cherry picked from commit c586caffa7ef00ae38918a30104f8eb94bfb1392)

need to move it out of the build run and to the node setup playbooks.

New Developer Docs

These were derived from the etherpad we worked on during the PTG.  I reworked
the info and added some things.  Please review and add things if you want.

Change-Id: Icb4ddbb6524ed793ad63c22e0dfd8fcc0dccbbf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/02/506702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Information for New Developers ============================== The intension of this document is to give new developers some information regarding how to get started with TripleO as well as some best practices that the TripleO community has settled on. In general TripleO is a very complex chunk of software. It uses numerous technologies to implement an OpenStack installer. The premise of TripleO was to use the OpenStack platform itself as the installer and API for user interfaces. As such the first step to installing TripleO is to create what is called an `undercloud`. Today this is typically done using an undercloud image which contains all the software necessary to stand up an all-in-one style OpenStack installation. Once the `undercloud` is deployed, we use a combination of Mistral and a set of Heat templates, found in the `tripleo-heat-templates` repository, to drive the deployment of an overcloud. Ironic is used to provision hardware and boot an operating system either on baremetal (for real deployments) or on VMs (for development). As of the Pike release we now deploy almost all services in containers on the overcloud. By the end of Queens all services should be containerized and the overcloud image should be reduced to a basic operating system image. We are also working on unifying the architecture of the overcloud and undercloud by moving to a containerized undercloud. This allows you to do development on the undercloud using the same Heat templates as are used to deploy the overcloud. This greatly accelerates development iteration cycle speed. Repositories used for TripleO ----------------------------- * tripleo-common: This is intended to be for TripleO libraries of common code. Unfortunately it has become a bit overrun with unrelated bits. Work is ongoing to clean this up and split this into separate repositories. * tripleo-heat-templates: This contains all the Heat templates necessary to deploy the overcloud (and hopefully soon the undercloud as well). The layout of this repository is better covered in the architecture section of these documents. * tripleo-docs: Where these docs are kept. :) * tripleo-image-elements: Image elements for building the undercloud and overcloud disk images. * tripleo-puppet-elements: Puppet is used to configure the services in TripleO. This repository contains various puppet modules for doing this. * tripleo-quickstart: Quickstart is an Ansible driven deployment for TripleO used in CI. Most developers also use this to stand up instances for development as well. * tripleo-ui: The graphical user interface for deploying TripleO. * paunch: This is a library that is used to deploy containers. It is called from the Heat templates during installation to deploy our containerized services. * kolla: We use the containers built by the Kolla project for services in TripleO. Any new containers or additions to existing containers should be submitted here. Definition of Done ------------------ This is basically a check list of things that you want to think about when implementing a new feature. Especially important is considering how the user interface functions along side the command line interface. - Ensure that any new feature is provided through Rest API in form of Mistral actions, workflow or by directly accessing an OpenStack service API. - Ensure that GUI and CLI operate this feature through this API - Start your feature work by creating Mistral action or Mistral workflow - defining inputs and outputs. This is necessary so that the CI and UI have feature parity and both use the same API calls to implement a given feature. - Ensure that the continuous integration (CI) is in place and passing, adding coverage to tests if required. - Ensure there are unit tests where possible. - Maintain backwards compatibility with our existing template interfaces from tripleo-heat-templates - New features should be reviewed by cores who have knowledge in that area of the codebase. - One should consider logging and support implications. - If you have new logs, would they be available via sosreport? - Error messages are easy to understand and work their way back to the user (stack traces are not sufficient). - Documentation should be updated if necessary. New features need a tripleo-docs patch. - If any new dependencies are used for your feature, be sure they are properly packaged and available in RDO. - If a Mistral workflow changes between releases, make version notes so that users know how they might have to update their workflow call. Using the Containerized Undercloud for Local development of heat templates and containers. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ While not yet part of the TripleO distribution, we have a functioning containerized undercloud that we have been using for development purposes. This reuses much of the existing TripleO heat templates, allowing you to do development using this framework instead of a complete overcloud. The iteration time for starting the undercloud via containers is MUCH shorter - typically 15 minutes or less and you could also reduce the services to make it even faster. This is very useful if you are developing heat templates or containerized services. Setting up the containerized undercloud: https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-docs/latest/install/containers_deployment/undercloud.html Notes: what is the API in tripleo? we should talk about that. Mistral workflows / actions user input -> cli/ui -> mistral data validation -> ??? -> plan? Docs, about the API, the flow, design/concepts (e.g. what is a plan, how is it used/consumed) Revisit standardization of Mistral workflow, action and zaqar messages output, so they are equal and easy to parse by client (this is important mostly for errors as those are currently inconsistent - multiple nesting such as output.result.message.message etc.)

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs to project

This patch implements first step in zuulv3 migration guide [1]:
Move jobs to aodh repo

also cleanup integration gate

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details

Change-Id: I741ede216374b6bb93dab3960e8018e3a5204484
Co-Authored-By: Kien Nguyen <KienNT@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: gord chung <gord@live.ca>

added_lines:
- hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-telemetry-dsvm-integration-aodh from old job gate-telemetry-dsvm-integration-aodh-ubuntu-xenial tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat > clonemap.yaml << EOF clonemap: - name: openstack-infra/devstack-gate dest: devstack-gate EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m clonemap.yaml --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack-infra/devstack-gate executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_HEAT=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 if [ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" == "stable/newton" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=0 else export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 fi export DEVSTACK_GATE_EXERCISES=0 export DEVSTACK_GATE_INSTALL_TESTONLY=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_NOTESTS=1 export PROJECTS="openstack/ceilometer openstack/aodh" # NOTE(sileht): This job runs on Aodh and Ceilometer. # Gnocchi uses an independent release cycle. So we map here # which Gnocchi version can be used with other OpenStack # components and the reverse. case "$ZUUL_BRANCH" in "stable/newton") export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin gnocchi git://git.openstack.org/openstack/gnocchi" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin panko git://git.openstack.org/openstack/panko" export OVERRIDE_GNOCCHI_PROJECT_BRANCH="stable/3.0" export PROJECTS="openstack/panko $PROJECTS openstack/gnocchi" ;; "stable/ocata") export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin gnocchi git://git.openstack.org/openstack/gnocchi" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin panko git://git.openstack.org/openstack/panko" export OVERRIDE_GNOCCHI_PROJECT_BRANCH="stable/3.1" export PROJECTS="openstack/panko $PROJECTS openstack/gnocchi" ;; *) export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin panko git://git.openstack.org/openstack/panko" export PROJECTS="openstack/panko $PROJECTS" ;; esac export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin ceilometer git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ceilometer" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin aodh git://git.openstack.org/openstack/aodh" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin heat git://git.openstack.org/openstack/heat" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"CEILOMETER_BACKEND=gnocchi" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"GNOCCHI_ARCHIVE_POLICY=high" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"CEILOMETER_PIPELINE_INTERVAL=15" export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT=$ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME function post_test_hook { cd /opt/stack/new/ceilometer/ceilometer/tests/integration/hooks/ ./post_test_hook.sh } export -f post_test_hook cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: Ib24c5cb4f6bd9487ced12a0b98070ccf34d7fff6

commit_message:
Move fetch-zuul-cloner into legacy-base jobs

Old legacy jobs depend on zuul-cloner, so move the role out of our
base job into it. This will discourage non legacy jobs from using
zuul-cloner.

Change-Id: Ia09a4acc9c09535bf287208c77257bd3dca7a2bf
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/67/513067/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: roles: - role: fetch-zuul-cloner destination: "/usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner" repo_src_dir: "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org"

commit_message:
ocata2pike: add missing current-pike repo

TripleO packages were deployed from the current-tripleo repo (old from
11 days ago!) so we were testing upgrades from ocata to pike with old
version of TripleO packages, it couldn't work correctly.

This patch will deploy the current-pike repository and make sure we
deploy TripleO packages from it.

Related-Bug: #1714905
Change-Id: Ic689c473c3bcc421275eb04c918429954f7324e9

Change-Id: I738a2680bc3c8f71981ebd373f8bd4825853c957

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: I738a2680bc3c8f71981ebd373f8bd4825853c957

commit_message:
Remove ironic legacy jobs

ironic has moved its legacy devstack jobs definitions in-tree.
Let's not overconsume gate resources by running many
heavy identical jobs.

Depends-On: Ib728fadbdab2eb9f1ba5112297a32dbdbfd1d5fd
Change-Id: I8560148fc9b8d6201220699c74934c8cc3cef013

commit_message:
PCI NUMA Policies

bp share-pci-between-numa-nodes

Change-Id: Id908d5d67474851ae931b29028fe2e03386e4d3e
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/40/361140/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================== I/O (PCIe) sharing between NUMA nodes ===================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/share-pci-between-numa-nodes In Juno release "I/O based NUMA scheduling" spec was implemented [1]. This scheduling algorithm allows to boot VM with PCI devices *only* on NUMA nodes associated with these PCI devices. Before that nova booted VMs with PCI devices without checking NUMA nodes. But in some cases such hardcoded behaviour makes problems. Problem description =================== Booting VMs with PCI devices *only* on NUMA nodes associated with these PCI devices is good for performance. This ensures there is no cross NUMA node memory traffic. But if a user has environment with 2 NUMA nodes and only 1 PCI device (for example SR-IOV card associated with first NUMA node) he or she would be able to boot VMs with SR-IOV ports only on the first NUMA node. In this case user cannot use half of CPUs and half of RAM because these resources are placed on second NUMA node. Half of compute host is unused. User should be able to choose scheduling behaviour. In described case user should be able to boot VMs on different NUMA nodes, even if it makes performance on second NUMA node worse. Of course this ability should be configurable and the current scheduling behaviour must be default. Use Cases --------- Users with environments in which number of PCI devices is less than NUMA nodes will be able to use all of their hardware resources (CPUs, RAM). Proposed change =============== Add new config option 'share_pci_between_numa_nodes' in default section of nova config. This option will be used by scheduler's NUMATopologyFilter which will decide on which NUMA nodes VM can be booted. Default value of this option will be 'False'. It means that Nova will boot VMs with PCI devices *only* on NUMA nodes associated with these PCI devices (current behaviour). The 'True' value will mean that scheduler will ignore association of PCI devices and NUMA nodes. Alternatives ------------ Left current scheduler behaviour and buy more PCI devices to give each NUMA node its own PCI device. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ If described config option will have 'True' value the performance of VMs on NUMA nodes without associated PCI devices will be worse than performance of VMs on NUMA nodes with associated PCI devices. But with current scheduler behavior NUMA nodes without associated PCI devices wouldn't be used at all. If option will have 'False' value scheduler behaviour will be the same as current behaviour. Other deployer impact --------------------- To use this feature the deployer must use HW that is capable of reporting NUMA related info to the OS. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Sergey Nikitin (snikitin) Work Items ---------- * Add option 'share_pci_between_numa_nodes' to Nova config * Use this opting to change scheduler behavior Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Scenario tests will be added to validate these modifications. Documentation Impact ==================== This feature will not add a new scheduling filter, but it will change the behaviour of NUMATopologyFilter. We should add documentation to describe new config option. References ========== [1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/juno/approved/input-output-based-numa-scheduling.html

commit_message:
Add compatibility shims for wait_for_volume_resource_status

Devstack and our gate will only install and run tempest from the master
branch.  Any stable project release that has in-tree tempest tests and
relies on certain tempest functions becomes fragile as tempest is a
moving target.

Commit 52d7b0d62600b24f516070a4cc5f4194d5cffc76 renamed a
project-dependent function for several projects, specifically glance and
cinder.  An example can be seen here:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/417329/

Reverting the change would break other projects that have already been
updated and updating the stable branch in cinder would allow the gate to
pass (since we only run master) but would break third parties.

This patch adds the necessary functions to allow the voting jobs to pass
for stable backports.

Change-Id: I49ad73200cd07823f0fcc50cff1ee4d4a1fe57ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/38/461438/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def wait_for_volume_status(client, volume_id, status): """Compatibility shim for stable clients.""" return wait_for_volume_resource_status(client, volume_id, status) def wait_for_snapshot_status(client, snapshot_id, status): """Compatibility shim for stable clients.""" return wait_for_volume_resource_status(client, snapshot_id, status) def wait_for_backup_status(client, backup_id, status): """Compatibility shim for stable clients.""" return wait_for_volume_resource_status(client, backup_id, status)

commit_message:
Add linters job to all OSA role jobs

In Ic672ac977ee96becb0d26b3310d8865862b35456 all functional
tests were removed for all OSA roles, but the removal of the
use of the ansible-role-jobs template also removed the lint
test facilitated by the 'linters' tox environment.

This adds jobs to each repository to return these jobs to
each repository.

Change-Id: I323dae041aaaec6d295110ac883b1e5dbc6841c5

commit_message:
Add get_resource_provider to placement client

This function allows to retrieve an specific Resource Provider
by its UUID.

This feature depends on Nova Nested Resource Providers.

Depends-On: I4db74e4dc682bc03df6ec94cd1c3a5f5dc927a7bi

Change-Id: I41e9ab068ebbc97ba9ce6d3b095d64b1509a8686
Partial-Bug: #1578989

added_lines: def test_get_resource_provider(self): self.placement_api_client.get_resource_provider('r_provider_1') self.mock_get.assert_called_once_with( '/resource_providers/r_provider_1') def test_get_resource_provider_no_resource_provider(self): self.mock_get.side_effect = ks_exc.NotFound() self.assertRaises(n_exc.PlacementResourceProviderNotFound, self.placement_api_client.get_resource_provider, 'r_provider_1')

subject: Remove 'next' for GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-21 14:18:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/aa0bcdd190adac0e35525f2d9d8f9ffff10d9dbe', 'message': 'No 'next' for GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=

If
This fixes it so that a 'next' link is not returned in the response
for a "GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=<uuid>" request. Since

For a "GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=<uuid>" request that has a
node that matches, the response would include a 'next' link
(which is incorrect, it would return any nodes). However,
at most one node can match the specified instance UUID, so
no 'next' link should be returned. This fixes it.

Change-Id: I4efe06652baf3423790c238d4a8d2bc5a736b3a5
Closes-Bug: #1718683
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-21 14:24:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/8eed047b85b96bef58ac672fb43f5d06f082c368', 'message': 'Remove 'next' for GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=

For a "GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=<uuid>" request that has a
node that matches, the response would include a 'next' link
(which is incorrect -- that link would return any nodes). However,
at most one node can match the specified instance UUID, so
we should not be returning any 'next' link. This fixes it so no
'next' link is returned.

Change-Id: I4efe06652baf3423790c238d4a8d2bc5a736b3a5
Closes-Bug: #1718683
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-09-21 15:57:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/12f5cdc0d079d773cb7ce15963672067e8782d06', 'message': 'Remove 'next' for GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=

node that matches, the response would include a 'next' link.
(Note that the generated 'next' link happens to be incorrect; it
doesn't include 'instance_uuid'). However, at most one node can match

For a "GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=<uuid>" request that has a
node that matches, the response would include a 'next' link.

commit_message:
Remove 'next' for GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=

For a "GET /nodes?limit=1&instance_uuid=<uuid>" request that has a
node that matches, the response would include a 'next' link.
(Note that the generated 'next' link happens to be incorrect; it
doesn't include 'instance_uuid'). However, at most one node can match
the specified instance UUID, so we should not be returning any 'next'
link.

This fixes it so no 'next' link is returned.

Change-Id: I4efe06652baf3423790c238d4a8d2bc5a736b3a5
Closes-Bug: #1718683

deleted_lines: parameters = {'sort_key': sort_key, 'sort_dir': sort_dir} if associated: parameters['associated'] = associated if maintenance: parameters['maintenance'] = maintenance

commit_message:
Allow to specify user and project domains in CLIclient

Currently it's impossible to provide related parameters
to the class, which leads to clients functional tests
failures.

Change-Id: I50490428f85e264e6b5e3b7c83ff768a986cb8c8
Closes-bug: #1719687

commit_message:
Only build ARA report when test fails

In order to reduce the quantity of unnecessary log content
being kept in OpenStack-Infra we only generate the ARA report
when the test result is a failure. The ARA sqlite database is
still available for self generation if desired for successful
tests.

Change-Id: I3ab9752650911bba0b8be5e73b65019e97bfef42
(cherry picked from commit ceee7c1be506ab2c08e1e9dcfd1159d5de8c10ea)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/22/511922/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # In order to reduce the quantity of unnecessary log content # being kept in OpenStack-Infra we only generate the ARA report # when the test result is a failure. The ARA sqlite database is # still available for self generation if desired for successful # tests. if [[ "${TEST_EXIT_CODE}" != "0" ]]; then echo "Generating ARA report due to non-zero exit code (${TEST_EXIT_CODE})." ${ARA_CMD} "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/ara" || true else echo "Not generating ARA report due to test pass." fi

commit_message:
Add OpenStack-Ansible metadata

We need to add openstack ansible information in the role
metadata to be able to track role maturity. With it,
we can create a role maturity table and take decisions about
role deprecations.

Change-Id: I679e7ce67139e02d3369d448d0dc12a3d7b94521

commit_message:
WIP: Debug upgrade test failures

1. Increase the timeout for agent calls.
2. Add logging to mysql guest agent post_upgrade
3. Fix test case exception handling
Under 9ec134996a1162de0d74ef915dc138bbacbcfdf1 the
exception that failed test cases was raised with a bare
'raise' to preserve the original traceback. This introduced
another issue where log reporting in the exception block
could fail and that exception would be raised.
This fixes the exception handling to preserve the original
traceback and prevent exceptions in error handling being
raised.

Change-Id: Ic1ef4305e9203ffa39bb6e5fe5cbe342bc612c40

Adjust a test that attempts to verify that a CHECK constraint
has been dropped to use raw SQL, as the Boolean datatype

Change-Id: I99ffce63f9646323d9e2e3079e52b4829d996ea6
'}]
commit_message:
Test illegal "boolean" values without Boolean datatype

Adjust a test that attempts to verify that a CHECK constraint
has been dropped to use raw SQL, as the Boolean datatype
in SQLAlchemy 1.1 is coercing the target value of "10" to a "1"
 in any case.   Starting with SQLAlchemy 1.2, the Python-side
Boolean datatype will also raise an error.

Change-Id: I99ffce63f9646323d9e2e3079e52b4829d996ea6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/04/511504/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(zzzeek): SQLAlchemy 1.2 Boolean type will disallow non 1/0 # value here, 1.1 also coerces to "1/0" so use raw SQL to test the # constraint with self.engine.connect() as conn: conn.execute( "INSERT INTO abc (deleted) VALUES (?)", (10, ) ) self.assertEqual( 10, conn.scalar("SELECT deleted FROM abc") )

commit_message:
Disallow rolling upgrade from Ocata to Queens

Now that we've released Pike and master is open for Queens
development, we need to remove the release mapping information
for Ocata, to prevent unsupported rolling upgrades from
Ocata to Queens. We only support rolling upgrades from Pike
to Queens (master).

Change-Id: I440b9a4c8ef6024a47b66b0de4fd841b7f15df2e

Fix ZUUL_REFNAME for translation jobs

Pass in the branch in upstream_translation for Zuul v3 and use it
instead of ZUUL_REFNAME.

commit_message:
Fix mis-formatted log messages

Fix errors in log messages. These were detected by a patch that catches
these types of errors. Submitting these fixes first as the patch to
detect the errors will likely take more time to get merged.

Conflicts:
    ironic/drivers/modules/oneview/deploy_utils.py

Closes-Bug: #1722597
Change-Id: Ibe451f9cd97971cb83366fdc6f7f5c31d2af4793
(cherry picked from commit df5da4ce7a32e64e34a489b741bd911f9c55ea34)

commit_message:
Mock _wait_for_interface in test_run_with_sleep

When running unit tests in an environment without network access,
for example in a packaging env, test_run_with_sleep fails with a
timeout trying to list the network interfaces [1].

Mocking the _wait_for_interface call, as it is done currently on
master and stable/pike, fixes the issue. The original commit is
fdcb0922a5c4a4ecbb8cb1b307c6c750990699ff; this patch only grabs
the one mock from the original change.

[1] - See https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-ocata/8a/70/8a70c4d575c3b5bef2debde8512ed3200ccc8d4c_aa5406af/rpmbuild.log

Change-Id: I5010ea78b4794afb72f86762b7e6fc31c1540436

commit_message:
Add OpenStack-Ansible metadata

We need to add openstack ansible information in the role
metadata to be able to track role maturity. With it,
we can create a role maturity table and take decisions about
role deprecations.

Change-Id: Ib3a4a97bb75a602346feca9f4c6ac81285a20c98

commit_message:
Deploy kubernetes using TripleO on the overcloud

Currently this still requires some manual intervention on undercloud
-- check out a local copy of kubespray.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1b57646e917b9e60f12b64839682919992af6ad6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/59/471759/49 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: ocata description: Triggers a Mistral workflow for the deployment of Kubernetes parameters: RoleNetIpMap: default: {} type: json ServiceNetMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service_name -> network name. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. This mapping overrides those in ServiceNetMapDefaults. type: json DefaultPasswords: default: {} type: json RoleName: default: '' description: Role name on which the service is applied type: string RoleParameters: default: {} description: Parameters specific to the role type: json EndpointMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service endpoint -> protocol. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. type: json outputs: role_data: description: Role data for the Kubernetes Service value: service_name: kubernetes_worker config_settings: {} upgrade_tasks: [] step_config: ''

subject: Fix puppet-agent install
revisions:

packages, let's use proper ansible.

commit_message:
Fix puppet-agent install

The previous declaration where we installed the puppet-agent was after
we revoked sudo access. We need this to be part of the node setup so we
need to move it out of the build run and to the node setup playbooks.

Depends-On: I2fb0301631eb69bd1e37467229bcf3dc4ab532bb
Change-Id: Id68ee1b443a4172d0c1d6d58a04908c52a566623

deleted_lines: - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x if [ -f /usr/bin/yum ]; then sudo yum install -y https://yum.puppetlabs.com/puppetlabs-release-pc1-el-7.noarch.rpm sudo yum install -y puppet-agent elif [ -f /usr/bin/apt-get ]; then wget https://apt.puppetlabs.com/puppetlabs-release-pc1-xenial.deb -O /tmp/puppet.deb sudo dpkg -i /tmp/puppet.deb sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install puppet-agent rm -rf /tmp/puppet.deb fi executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

Set SNAT mechanism to controller

SNAT mechanism by default is "conntrack". Set it to "controller"

commit_message:
Add OpenStack-Ansible metadata

We need to add openstack ansible information in the role
metadata to be able to track role maturity. With it,
we can create a role maturity table and take decisions about
role deprecations.

Change-Id: I706b51e8f64497def86a481372dbeebb1abf955a

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: Iafe9f3622037d7ba71f9ba8b73217f9e2070f246
(cherry picked from commit ac930796d66e7fdd952477df03d75c4024c8f5a2)

commit_message:
Add OpenStack-Ansible metadata

We need to add openstack ansible information in the role
metadata to be able to track role maturity. With it,
we can create a role maturity table and take decisions about
role deprecations.

The role status isn't "complete" because no functional test
of the role has been implemented.

Change-Id: I46ec637936c3690502c99d8797f942f45c11af51

commit_message:
Allow cluster create with no security groups

Got an unbound variable error without this fix:
  UnboundLocalError: local variable 'sec_groups'
  referenced before assignment

This appears to have been caused by the move to use the neutron client
in the following commit:
b4fb2c404c371a5ba9b28a3ac769c94e69b8c141

Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Freudberg <jeremyfreudberg@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1718940
Change-Id: I4f0b5a6b27ee2fb7821ec42faba3a69ce5a4bb78
(cherry picked from commit 88b427e98858990a35378370ba4b27691f6e6189)

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: Ib83267ef75f91fb8f95af312d644ebe29c6306c8

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated --pull-source option

The --pull-source option was deprecated in pike and we're now supposed
to prepend the registry address to the --namespace option.

Moreover the --pull-source option has a bug that causes docker.io
registry to be added twice to the ceph image.

Change-Id: I6acac1826271efcd4d1acf6633bde6eb8a653f44
Closes-Bug: #1724347

commit_message:
have release functions script source its own requirements

The release-tools/functions script needs common.sh but has been
relying on the calling script to source it properly. Have the
functions script source its own dependency to ensure it is always done
properly.

Change-Id: I2f1b6c32cf2f454bdc3a9841891f464da07dc788
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Setup nodes for upstream-translation job

The v2 proposal node had some existing python install that is lacking
in our v3 dynamically allocated nodes.

Install lxml and requests for the python scripts we use in our venv -
and create venv earlier and use that for the python scripts.

Change-Id: I377e91d50c50095264c9a47ede7995db5cb3b159

commit_message:
Move oslo.cache to gnocchi flavor

oslo.cache is only used in the Gnocchi dispatcher, and not at all in tests.
Therefore it seems wrong to list it in tests.
Rather than always depending on it, let's just put it in the gnocchi flavor.

Change-Id: I8990ba139bba0d573ecd4d8567a88d92acb29605

commit_message:
Add swap precheck and clean jobs

Before create and add swap on system, check whether swapfile
is mounted. If so, try to swapoff the swapfile and remove it.

Change-Id: Ic3a9ffc34872a83a491412237369442f369c21d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/77/456177/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $SUDO swapon -s |grep -q '/swapfile' if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then swapoff /swapfile && rm -f /swapfile fi

commit_message:
Implement zuul v2/v3 role fetch shim

In order to be able to simultaneously work with the
differing implementations of zuul-cloner in zuul v2
and zuul v3 we implement a detection routine to
behave appropriately for each version.

This is very much a band-aid just to help us transition
because once the transition to zuul v3 is complete we
should be able to ditch this whole playbook for
something built into zuul v3, and use something very
simple for executing tests when not using zuul.

Change-Id: Ic824e7ca7c564d5de7a27c77a79014ad274afade
(cherry picked from commit b58a2c02871140dfefccceb5f0ad326e1512fd97)

commit_message:
Default pre_deployments/post_deployments to empty lists

This is needed because these aren't defined by default when deploying
without config-download-environment.yaml and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508189/, but it's still useful to allow
re-running the deploy steps for debugging, e.g:

ansible-playbook -v -i /usr/bin/tripleo-ansible-inventory deploy_steps_playbook.yaml

Currently this doesn't work anymore, because these variables are undefined.

Change-Id: I2d99c1cb8bf4ccd8581e78d914d438e5de544219

subject: fix cleaning up evacuated instances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-10 16:49:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a5e0eaae2fec9004f3bc7d12080078e5d8659758', 'message': "fix cleaning up evacuated instances

When bug 1709902 was fixed in I0df401a7c91f012fdb25cb0e6b344ca51de8c309
the fix assumed that when the _destroy_evacuated_instances() is called
during the init of the nova-compute service the resource tracker
already knows the compute node ids associated to the given compute
host. This is not true and therefore _destroy_evacuated_instances fails
with and exception and does not clean up the evacuated instance.

The resource tracker's compute_nodes dict only initalized during the
first update_available_resource call that happens in the
pre_start_hook. While the _destroy_evacuate_instances called from
init_host which is called before the pre_hook_start.
The _destroy_evacuated_instances call uses the
_delete_allocation_for_moved_instance that relies on the resource
tracker's compute_nodes dict.

This patch modifies the _delete_allocation_for_moved_instance to use
a database query to figure out the compute node uuid if the
compute_nodes dict is not populated.

Change-Id: I35749374ff09b0e98064c75ff9c33dad577579c6
Closes-Bug: #1721652
Related-Bug: #1709902
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-10 16:52:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/24dac729f1dc4cb24a8aa550a1e5b3fc0d6313f0', 'message': "fix cleaning up evacuated instances

When bug 1709902 was fixed in I0df401a7c91f012fdb25cb0e6b344ca51de8c309
the fix assumed that when the _destroy_evacuated_instances() is called
during the init of the nova-compute service the resource tracker
already knows the compute node ids associated to the given compute
host. This is not true and therefore _destroy_evacuated_instances fails
with and exception and does not clean up the evacuated instance.

The resource tracker's compute_nodes dict only initalized during the
first update_available_resource call that happens in the
pre_start_hook. While the _destroy_evacuate_instances called from
init_host which is called before the pre_hook_start.
The _destroy_evacuated_instances call uses the
_delete_allocation_for_moved_instance that relies on the resource
tracker's compute_nodes dict.

This patch modifies the _delete_allocation_for_moved_instance to use
a database query to figure out the compute node uuid if the
compute_nodes dict is not populated.

Change-Id: I35749374ff09b0e98064c75ff9c33dad577579c6
Closes-Bug: #1721652
Related-Bug: #1709902

commit_message:
fix cleaning up evacuated instances

When bug 1709902 was fixed in I0df401a7c91f012fdb25cb0e6b344ca51de8c309
the fix assumed that when the _destroy_evacuated_instances() is called
during the init of the nova-compute service the resource tracker
already knows the compute node ids associated to the given compute
host. This is not true and therefore _destroy_evacuated_instances fails
with and exception and does not clean up the evacuated instance.

The resource tracker's compute_nodes dict only initalized during the
first update_available_resource call that happens in the
pre_start_hook. While the _destroy_evacuate_instances called from
init_host which is called before the pre_hook_start.
The _destroy_evacuated_instances call uses the
_delete_allocation_for_moved_instance that relies on the resource
tracker's compute_nodes dict.

This patch inlines _delete_allocation_for_moved_instance in
_destroy_evacuated_instances and queries the db for the compute node
uuid. As ironic uses 1:M host:node setup we cannot ask the db only once
about the node uuid as different instances might be on different nodes.

Change-Id: I35749374ff09b0e98064c75ff9c33dad577579c6
Closes-Bug: #1721652
Related-Bug: #1709902
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/510938/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_allocation_for_evacuated_instance(self, context, instance, node, context, instance, node, 'evacuated', node_type) def delete_allocation_for_migrated_instance(self, context, instance, node): self._delete_allocation_for_moved_instance( context, instance, node, 'migrated') self, context, instance, node, move_type, node_type='source'): if self.compute_nodes: cn_uuid = self.compute_nodes[node].uuid else: # This happens when we are called from # delete_allocation_for_evacuated_instance as that is called during # init_host of the manager and that point the compute_nodes of the # rt has not been populated yet. cn_uuid = self._get_compute_node(context, node).uuid
deleted_lines: def delete_allocation_for_evacuated_instance(self, instance, node, instance, node, 'evacuated', node_type) def delete_allocation_for_migrated_instance(self, instance, node): self._delete_allocation_for_moved_instance(instance, node, 'migrated') self, instance, node, move_type, node_type='source'): cn_uuid = self.compute_nodes[node].uuid

subject: live-migration test hook for serial console
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 16:18:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7c16583b614ec9fc314440c96c71fe8c1866dac8', 'message': 'WIP: live-migration test for serial console

The "serial console" feature is a non-graphical interactive console
to an instance. The testing gap for this feature resulted in some breaks
in the past.
This change introduces a hook into the live-migration test job which
configures the testing nodes to enable Tempest tests for instances with
a serial console.

This depends on a change in Tempest which introduces the "serial_console"
compute feature enablement.

Change-Id: I7af395a867e0657c26fa064d2b0134345cd96814
Related-Bug: 1455252
Depends-On: I020fd94d970ad0cdf7ab65d7656da6ca5766094b

in the past.
This change introduces a hook into the live-migration test job which
configures the testing nodes to enable Tempest tests for instances with
a serial console.

This depends on a change in Tempest which introduces the "serial_console"
compute feature enablement.

WIP:
* still contains debugging logs as the gate fails right now

Change-Id: I7af395a867e0657c26fa064d2b0134345cd96814
Related-Bug: 1455252
Depends-On: I020fd94d970ad0cdf7ab65d7656da6ca5766094b

commit_message:
live-migration test hook for serial console

The "serial console" feature is a non-graphical interactive console
to an instance. The testing gap for this feature resulted in some breaks
in the past.
This change introduces a hook into the live-migration test job which
configures the testing nodes to enable Tempest tests for instances with
a serial console. After the tempest tests are run, the default config
option values get restored.

Tempest commit 69d58b8 introduced the test for the serial console which
gets invoked with this hook.

Related-Bug: 1455252
Change-Id: I7af395a867e0657c26fa064d2b0134345cd96814
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/71/347471/31 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: source $BASE/new/nova/nova/tests/live_migration/hooks/serial_console.sh#run_tempest "Ceph nova&glance&cinder test" echo '5. test serial console live migration' # https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1455252 serial_console_setup serial_console_configure_tempest run_tempest "serial console tests"

commit_message:
Add installation guide for kuryr-libnetwork

This patch proposes an installation guide that covers step-by-step
deployment of kuryr-libnetwork for new users of OpenStack with
sufficient Linux experience.

The instruction is to install kuryr-libnetwork from source since
there is no distro package for kuryr-libnetwork for now. This guide
covers installation in Ubunut as the first stpe. The support of
other OS is future work.

TODO: Configure the CI to publish this guide to:
https://docs.openstack.org/pike/install/

Change-Id: Id4f234068600564fa18e73aba08f6e43893456ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/55/509655/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================= Kuryr-libnetwork overview ========================= Kuryr-libnetwork is Kuryr's Docker libnetwork driver that uses Neutron to provide networking services. It provides containerised images for the common Neutron plugins. Features -------- * Docker libnetwork remote driver * Docker libnetwork IPAM driver * Support for Linux Bridge, Open vSwitch, Midonet, and IOvisor port bindings * Support for using existing Neutron networks. * Support for using existing Neutron ports. * Support for the Docker "expose" option.

commit_message:
Passport Programm draft spec.

Change-Id: Iff9917386ebbf49fd76bceccb5709dd018477ea9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/publiccloud-sig refs/changes/52/511252/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _passport_program: The OpenStack Passport Program ============================== What? ----- The OpenStack Passport program is a joint initiative between the Public Cloud Working Group and the OpenStack Foundation. There are 60+ OpenStack public clouds available globally. Armed with an OpenStack Passport, a user will have the ability to easily gain a trial account on any participating cloud. The passports will be created by the OpenStack Foundation and distributed in both print and digital forms. Why? ---- To allow the OpenStack Foundation to act as a unified point of entry for public cloud users, and to help public cloud providers grow their userbases. When? ----- A low-tech landing page will be implemented for version 0 of the scheme and will be launched in November 2017 at the OpenStack Summit in Sydney. Version 1 is currently forecast to land in May 2018 in time for the OpenStack Summit in Vancouver. How? ---- Version 0 ^^^^^^^^^ * Landing page promoting various OpenStack-based public clouds that have signed up to the Passport program * Marketing exercise to raise awareness and guage interest from users and operators * Foundation understanding the various public cloud operators commercial offerings - sign up process, how much resource they have available, what services are on offer * The message: "valid for at least XX resources on any participating public cloud for 1 month" * To avoid value comparison, agree on a minimal amount of resources a token would be valid (it's ok to offer more)+1 * Should be limited in time. * APPLICATION CRITERIA: OpenStack interop - OpenStack powered as a requirement for Passport program participation (confirm with participants) * Public clouds report summary usage to the foundation every month or so (preserving personal information disclosure requirements)+1 * Success of this step will determine the rest... Version 1 ^^^^^^^^^ * How to measure utilisation - maybe don't base it on a dollar value, more on usage i.e a set quota of certain number of instances / volumes etc.+1 * Recommendation is that the public cloud operators are responsible for operating and maintaining any kind of centralized (or decentralized - blockchain?) method of token validation / revocation as well as usage tracking. * Foundation can generate signed tokens that can be validated on each public cloud using a public key * Local sig validation approach means that tokens can be reused across multiple public clouds, but that's actually not a bad thing * Public clouds must locally mark tokens as used so that they can't be infinitely reused on their cloud * Public clouds report summary usage to the foundation every month or so (preserving personal information disclosure requirements) * Code / token generation * Unique URL / QR code -- need to find a printer that would be OK printing lots of different QR codes * Something equivalent to the length of a Windows licensing key * QR code contains a URL like http://opensta.ck/?token=25495720598743957495874359874359845984375643509747350987823509473258572390857342095878 * leads to Foundation-hosted static page listing the participating clouds and the token (ready to be copy-pasted) * Token can be included as a parameter to the various public cloud links * Keys used to sign codes to be regenerated every ~ 6 months * Longevity of tokens (6 months, 1year...) * Is it more complex than it needs to be ? * Bunch of trial links on a page gets you 90% there. Let's see after step 0 if that level of complexity is actually necessary * Being able to terminate trial sign-ups in case of capacity issues Version 2 ^^^^^^^^^ TBA Selection Criteria ------------------ Participating cloud vendors need to meet the following criteria: 1) They must currently offer a free trial for new public cloud users. 2) They must provide a quality user experience, because confusing/longwinded processes dissuade users. There will be a definition of what a quality UX entails soon. 3) They must have a privacy policy, because OpenStack.org will be sending users to sign up directly for their service implement an official OpenStack graphic and agreed-upon text on your own website's landing page (details TBA); You are strongly encouraged to get involved with the bi-weekly IRC meetings hosted by the Public Cloud Working Group (more details below); You acknowledge that participation in the program does not necessarily guarantee traffic or users. Questions --------- 1. Can you use one passport on multiple clouds? 2. How do you limit the scope of the trial? Preloaded dollar value? VCPU hours? A dict of quotas for all resource types?

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: Ic04b7e658e7755c8e66e47a84442a5f3c791fa78

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: I3103b032d8847eeb044d87e0ed7950c9078e18a1

commit_message:
Update upgrade role for Queens from P

This changes the a-r-r with the proper version, and fixes
the repo path for role upgrades:

The role will, during test-upgrade-pre, have its current branch
checked out, and will deploy the current branch infrastructure,
including the generation of the constraints.

Then, the installation of previous branch of the role will use
the constraints for its previous version, but will have no
constraints for it, and fail.

We need to generate the constraints for the previous version too.
This should do it.

On top of that, we needed to update the work for Zuul v3:
This implements the initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs.

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: I8710e7b9bb6010ba98279f61a63274ace56f6e8d
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

commit_message:
EVPN/VXLAN linux: fix unplug

The change in Ie33880f1d6cca10a391bbe6a7cb13597046f597b does not
play out nicely with the use of bagpipe-bgp with linuxbridge agent:
on unplug it seems that the tap interface has already been removed.

This change adds a check before removing the state that the VM
interface is still on the bridge (if it's not, no cleanup is needed).

Change-Id: If6a85ffa7c4bc2bd837317eeebddbcb31774d081

added_lines: def _is_if_on_bridge(self, ifname): with pyroute2.IPDB(plugins=('interfaces',)) as ipdb: for port_id in ipdb.interfaces[self.bridge_name].ports: port = ipdb.interfaces[port_id] if port.ifname == ifname: return True return False def _is_vxlan_if_on_bridge(self): return self._is_if_on_bridge(self.vxlan_if_name) # remove local fdb entry, but only if tap interface is still here if self._is_if_on_bridge(localport['linuxif']): self._run_command("bridge fdb delete %s dev %s" % (mac_address, localport['linuxif']), run_as_root=True)
deleted_lines: def _is_vxlan_if_on_bridge(self): (output, _) = self._run_command( "brctl show %s | grep '%s' | sed -e 's/\s\+//g'" % (self.bridge_name, VXLAN_INTERFACE_PREFIX), run_as_root=True, shell=True) return True if (output == self.vxlan_if_name) else False self._run_command("bridge fdb delete %s dev %s" % (mac_address, localport['linuxif']), run_as_root=True)

subject: bagpipe-bgp: add cleanup assist
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-12 19:34:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/commit/8c19b370d9da3317b66046ef569ab63c9e8c3abd', 'message': 'bagpipe-bgp: add cleanup assist

The cleanup assist mecanism is introduced to handle the
case where at stop/cleanup time, a dataplane driver has
no simple mean to remove all the states it has created
in the dataplane.

We enhance VPNInstance and TrackerWorker so that, on stop(),
if the dataplane driver requires it, we simulate the withdrawal
of all received routes.

This is *not* done based on the unsubscribe mechanism, because
doing so would run into the problem of having to identify the
moment where all routes have been withdrawn, which the
RouteTableManager does not support.

This enhancement is used by the EVPN/VXLAN linux driver for the
cases where the vxlan interface is not created by the driver, but
reused from another component, making it impossible to remove
all dataplane states by removing the vxlan interface.

Change-Id: I8a00dc0a98f52be022a938254062db0abe43991f
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-12 21:10:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/commit/35e78b716b612c0f29035c446ed6851105bc6e88', 'message': 'bagpipe-bgp: add cleanup assist

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: add cleanup assist

The cleanup assist mecanism is introduced to handle the
case where at stop/cleanup time, a dataplane driver has
no simple mean to remove all the states it has created
in the dataplane.

We enhance VPNInstance and TrackerWorker so that, on stop(),
if the dataplane driver requires it, we simulate the withdrawal
of all received routes.

This is *not* done based on the unsubscribe mechanism, because
doing so would run into the problem of having to identify the
moment where all routes have been withdrawn, which the
RouteTableManager does not support.

This enhancement is used by the EVPN/VXLAN linux driver for the
cases where the vxlan interface is not created by the driver, but
reused from another component, making it impossible to remove
all dataplane states by removing the vxlan interface.

This change also replace the VPNInstance Lock with an RLock
which really is the kind of Lock we need.

Change-Id: I8a00dc0a98f52be022a938254062db0abe43991f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/62/511562/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.stop_event_loop() def stop_event_loop(self): self._please_stop.set() self.enqueue(STOP_EVENT)

subject: BGPVPN L2/EVPN: use same VNI as the associated network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-07 15:37:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/commit/eb291ac7d31e6ce7944c873ffb4240c34f3a2752', 'message': 'BGPVPN L2/EVPN: use same VNI as the associated network

With this change, when a VXLAN network is associated to an L2 BGPVPN
bagpipe-bgp will be given as a VNI to use for the EVPN, the VNI
of the network.

Additionally, the behavior of bagpipe-bgp EVPN/VXLAN driver is modified
so that whenever a VXLAN interface with the target VNI already exists
on the bridge for a given EVPN, this interface will be reused.

The result is that when a VXLAN network is associated to an L2 BGPVPN,
the VNI of the network will be used for EVPN and the VXLAN interface of the
bridge for this network will be reused, avoiding tricky questions
that would be raised if two vxlan interfaces were used on that bridge.

Change-Id: I9b360a90826104b09462542483f0b08df632531c

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2017-09-12 09:05:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/commit/462ad0031baf8ea4e6315cddfd87b8653da02e70', 'message': "BGPVPN L2/EVPN: use same VNI as the associated network

With this change, the following happens when a VXLAN network is
associated to an L2 BGPVPN: bagpipe-bgp will be given, as a VNI
to use for the EVPN, the VNI of the network.  This currently applies
to linuxbridge only (no EVPN OVS driver yet).

Additionally, the behavior of bagpipe-bgp EVPN/VXLAN driver is modified
so that whenever a VXLAN interface with the target VNI already exists
on the bridge for a given EVPN, this interface will be reused.

The result is that when a VXLAN network is associated to an L2 BGPVPN,
the VNI of the network will be used for EVPN and the VXLAN interface
of the bridge for this network will be reused, avoiding tricky questions
that would be raised if two vxlan interfaces were used on that bridge.

To make this possible, changes were brought around agent extensions to
adadpt to the fact that the VNI of a network is known by our extension
at handle_port time, which may be after the reception of the
bgpvpn_port_attach RPC.

This change also update unit tests involving bagpipe L2 so that they
use networks of type 'route_target' rather than 'vxlan'. The latter was
wrong, but not making a difference before this change.

Change-Id: I9b360a90826104b09462542483f0b08df632531c

commit_message:
BGPVPN L2/EVPN: use same VNI as the associated network

With this change, the following happens when a VXLAN network is
associated to an L2 BGPVPN: bagpipe-bgp will be given, as a VNI
to use for the EVPN, the VNI of the network.  This currently applies
to linuxbridge only (no EVPN OVS driver yet).

Additionally, the behavior of bagpipe-bgp EVPN/VXLAN driver is modified
so that whenever a VXLAN interface with the target VNI already exists
on the bridge for a given EVPN, this interface will be reused.

The result is that when a VXLAN network is associated to an L2 BGPVPN,
the VNI of the network will be used for EVPN and the VXLAN interface
of the bridge for this network will be reused, avoiding tricky questions
that would be raised if two vxlan interfaces were used on that bridge.

To make this possible, changes were brought around agent extensions to
adadpt to the fact that the VNI of a network is known by our extension
at handle_port time, which may be after the reception of the
bgpvpn_port_attach RPC.

Change-Id: I9b360a90826104b09462542483f0b08df632531c

commit_message:
Make legacy gates working

- make pep8 working by removing ChangeLog that is not generated
- make maven working by removing condidation for user
- make legacy dsvm working by using $USER intstead of hardcoded jenkins

Change-Id: I30f2edc4d34d0fad63f961f99dcecaf5c767f57f

commit_message:
Fix deploy-guide publish

We publish deploy-guide to /latest or /branchname - like we do with
normal documents. Fix location for this.

We can use the same logic as for normal repos, keeping in mind that the
docs live under deploy-guide, not doc.

Depends-On: I61cd84be201d14d0a1d5daba3a45c8797496bc7f
Change-Id: Ifff767a95e6283c54033bababd3dae84bb19adb6

commit_message:
Allow multiple binding drivers

In before, only one binding driver is allowed. This patch introduces
a new config to support multiple binding drivers. The first use case
is to allow SR-IOV binding to be co-existed with other binding.

* Rename the config 'driver' to 'default_driver' in 'binding' group.
  This is for making it clear that it is allowed to have more than
  one type of bindings.
* Introduce a new config called 'enabled_drivers'.
* Allow client to pass a driver name to port_bind and port_unbind.
  If this parameter is None, kuryr will load the default driver.

Partial-Implements: blueprint sriov-binding
Change-Id: I14b23379de9f2459ba97d5d82dfdb51553370cb1

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: I9763a35b0177693bce2904f0c9a0f70408c5d4de

commit_message:
Update upgrade role for Queens from P

This changes the a-r-r with the proper version, and fixes
the repo path for role upgrades:

The role will, during test-upgrade-pre, have its current branch
checked out, and will deploy the current branch infrastructure,
including the generation of the constraints.

Then, the installation of previous branch of the role will use
the constraints for its previous version, but will have no
constraints for it, and fail.

We need to generate the constraints for the previous version too.
This should do it.

This patch also implements an initial set of jobs intended to
match the current job execution method. It does not intend to
improve how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is
currently in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide
the platform to iterate on.

commit_message:
Eliminate ovsdb error in dsvm functional test

Meet the constraints of schema to eliminate ovsdb error log[0] cause by
passing a NoneType port_id.

[0] attempting to write bad value to column external_ids (ovsdb
error: expected string, got <type 'NoneType'>)

Change-Id: I2b0bd6bf3d4392443b24c56634c57adb03c9f72f
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
prepare-docs-for-afs: Allow reuse

Allow reuse of the roles for other directories than doc/build/html with
making doc_build_dir a variable that can be overwritten. This allows to
use the role also for e.g. deploy-guide that lives under
deploy-guide/source and builds under deploy-guide/build.

Change-Id: I61cd84be201d14d0a1d5daba3a45c8797496bc7f
Needed-By: Ifff767a95e6283c54033bababd3dae84bb19adb6

added_lines: doc_build_dir: "{{ zuul_work_dir }}/doc/build"
